segment.source: Troubleshooting the ACT Configuration Wizard (Windows 10)
segment.target: Troubleshooting the ACT Configuration Wizard (Windows 10)

segment.source: When you start Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) for the first time, the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Configuration Wizard appears.
segment.target: When you start Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) for the first time, the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Configuration Wizard appears.

segment.source: Troubleshooting the ACT Configuration Wizard
segment.target: Troubleshooting the ACT Configuration Wizard

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: When you start Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) for the first time, the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Configuration Wizard appears.
segment.target: When you start Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) for the first time, the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Configuration Wizard appears.

segment.source: The wizard helps you configure your ACT database, your shared folder for ACT log files, and your ACT Log Processing Service account.
segment.target: The wizard helps you configure your ACT database, your shared folder for ACT log files, and your ACT Log Processing Service account.

segment.source: Selecting a Configuration for ACM
segment.target: Selecting a Configuration for ACM

segment.source: The Enterprise configuration option enables all ACT functionality.
segment.target: The Enterprise configuration option enables all ACT functionality.

segment.source: You must be an administrator on the local computer to select this option.
segment.target: You must be an administrator on the local computer to select this option.

segment.source: The View and manage reports only option enables you to use ACM to create data-collection packages and analyze your data.
segment.target: The View and manage reports only option enables you to use ACM to create data-collection packages and analyze your data.

segment.source: You cannot access the ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: You cannot access the ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.source: This option assumes that another computer in your organization is processing the logs and loading the compatibility data into the ACT database.
segment.target: This option assumes that another computer in your organization is processing the logs and loading the compatibility data into the ACT database.

segment.source: Configuring ACT Database Settings
segment.target: Configuring ACT Database Settings

segment.source: To configure ACT database settings in the ACT Configuration Wizard, you must have read and write permissions to the ACT database.
segment.target: To configure ACT database settings in the ACT Configuration Wizard, you must have read and write permissions to the ACT database.

segment.source: For more information, see ACT Database Configuration.
segment.target: For more information, see ACT Database Configuration.

segment.source: If you do not have the appropriate permissions, contact your Microsoft® SQL Server® administrator.
segment.target: If you do not have the appropriate permissions, contact your Microsoft® SQL Server® administrator.

segment.source: For more information, see Troubleshooting ACT Database Issues.
segment.target: For more information, see Troubleshooting ACT Database Issues.

segment.source: Configuring the ACT Log Processing Service
segment.target: Configuring the ACT Log Processing Service

segment.source: If you use the Local System account to run the ACT Log Processing Service, your user account must be an Administrator account.
segment.target: If you use the Local System account to run the ACT Log Processing Service, your user account must be an Administrator account.

segment.source: Your computer account domaincomputer$ must have read and write permissions to the ACT database.
segment.target: Your computer account domaincomputer$ must have read and write permissions to the ACT database.

segment.source: Your user account must also have Log on as a service permissions.
segment.target: Your user account must also have Log on as a service permissions.

segment.source: For more information, see Troubleshooting the ACT Log Processing Service.
segment.target: For more information, see Troubleshooting the ACT Log Processing Service.

segment.source: Configuring the Share for the ACT Log Processing Service
segment.target: Configuring the Share for the ACT Log Processing Service

segment.source: For information about how to configure the share for the ACT Log Processing Service, see ACT LPS Share Permissions.
segment.target: For information about how to configure the share for the ACT Log Processing Service, see ACT LPS Share Permissions.

segment.source: Changing Settings After You Finish the ACT Configuration Wizard
segment.target: Changing Settings After You Finish the ACT Configuration Wizard

segment.source: In the Settings dialog box in ACM, you can change some of the settings that you see in the ACT Configuration Wizard.
segment.target: In the Settings dialog box in ACM, you can change some of the settings that you see in the ACT Configuration Wizard.

segment.source: You can also change other settings that are not available in the wizard.
segment.target: You can also change other settings that are not available in the wizard.

segment.source: For more information, see Settings for ACM.
segment.target: For more information, see Settings for ACM.

segment.source: Restarting the ACT Configuration Wizard
segment.target: Restarting the ACT Configuration Wizard

segment.source: If you cancel the configuration process before you reach the final page of the ACT Configuration Wizard, your settings are deleted and the wizard restarts the next time that you start ACM.
segment.target: If you cancel the configuration process before you reach the final page of the ACT Configuration Wizard, your settings are deleted and the wizard restarts the next time that you start ACM.
